description: Learned patterns that guide Claude's behavior. High-confidence instincts (>=0.6) are surfaced at session start.

confidenceScoring.description: Confidence increases when instinct leads to successful outcomes, decreases on failures

instincts.pattern: When the same error appears 3+ times, STOP immediately. The approach is fundamentally flawed - trying again won't help.
instincts.action: Invoke circuit-breaker skill and switch to root-cause analysis

instincts.pattern: When editing the same file 3+ times without solving the problem, step back and read related files first.
instincts.action: Pause edits, read imports and dependent files, understand the full context

instincts.pattern: Never claim 'this should work' or 'the fix is complete' without running verification commands first.
instincts.action: Run: npm run build, npm test, or relevant verification command. Read output. Only then claim success.

instincts.pattern: Hedging language ('probably', 'should', 'might') indicates uncertainty. Convert to verification steps.
instincts.action: Replace hedging with specific verification: 'Let me verify by running X' instead of 'This probably works'

instincts.pattern: Tasks taking >10 minutes are too large. Decompose into 2-5 minute subtasks.
instincts.action: Break task into atomic steps, each with a clear verification condition

instincts.pattern: When encountering repeated failures in the same file, step back and read the entire file before making more changes
instincts.action: Use Read tool on the full file, understand structure before editing

instincts.pattern: Before implementing a feature, search for existing patterns in the codebase to maintain consistency
instincts.action: Use Glob/Grep to find similar implementations, follow existing patterns

instincts.pattern: When a TypeScript error mentions 'undefined', prefer optional chaining (?.) over explicit null checks for cleaner code
instincts.action: Use obj?.prop instead of obj && obj.prop, use ?? for defaults

instincts.pattern: After writing code, run the build/tests immediately rather than writing more code to catch errors early
instincts.action: Run verification after each logical change, not after all changes

instincts.pattern: When creating a new React component, check if a similar component exists that can be extended or composed
instincts.action: Search for components in src/components before creating new ones

instincts.pattern: All API endpoints must validate input with Zod before processing
instincts.action: Add z.object() schema validation at the start of every route handler

instincts.pattern: When an error contains a file path and line number, read that exact location before attempting to fix
instincts.action: Parse error message, read file at specified line with context (-B 5 -A 10)
